Uses of Interface
roborally.IRobot

Uses of IRobot in roborally
 

Methods in roborally that return IRobot
 IRobot IFacade.createRobot(long x, long y, int orientation, double energy)
          Create a new Robot at coordinate (x, y) looking at orientation with energy watt-second.
 

Methods in roborally with parameters of type IRobot
 double IFacade.getEnergy(IRobot robot)
          Return the current energy in watt-second of robot.
 double IFacade.getEnergyRequiredToReach(IRobot robot, long x, long y)
          Return the minimum amount of energy required by robot to reach coordinate (x, y).
 int IFacade.getOrientation(IRobot robot)
          Return the orientation (either 0, 1, 2 or 3) of robot.
 long IFacade.getX(IRobot robot)
          Return the x-coordinate of robot.
 long IFacade.getY(IRobot robot)
          Return the y-coordinate of robot.
 void IFacade.move(IRobot robot)
          Move robot one step in its current direction if the robot has sufficient energy.
 void IFacade.moveNextTo(IRobot robot, IRobot robot2)
          Move robot as close as possible to robot2 consuming as little energy as possible.
 void IFacade.recharge(IRobot rogot, double energyAmount)
          Add energyAmount (expressed in watt-second) to robot.
 void IFacade.turnClockwise(IRobot robot)
          Turn robot 90 degrees in clockwise direction if the robot has sufficient energy.
